25. If the equation a(b – c)x2 + b(c – a)x + c(a – b) = 0 has equal roots, where a + c = 15 and  , then 36 b  5 a2 + c2 is equal to ________

C : Self-induced e.m.f.  opposes any change in the current in a circuit. D : Self-inductance is electromagnetic analogue of mass in mechanics. question_text: 27. A light hollow cube of side length 10 cm and mass 10g, is floating in water. It is pushed down and released to execute simple harmonic oscillations. The  time  period  of  oscillations  is  y  ×  s, 10–2 where the value of y is (Acceleration due to gravity, g = 10 m/s2, density of water = 103 kg/m3)
solution: a2x g = ma net L 2  g x  a m net T = 2 L 2  g m where m = 10g, L = 10 cm, = 1000 kg/m3

question_text: 28. Given below are two statements: Statement-I : The hot water flows faster than cold water. Statement-II  :  Soap  water  has  higher  surface tension as compared to fresh water. In the light above statements, choose the correct answer from the options given below

options.(1): Statement-I is false but Statement II is true
options.(2): Statement-I is true but Statement II is false
options.(3): Both Statement-I and Statement-II are true
options.(4): Both Statement-I and Statement-II are false

solution: Hot water is less viscous then cold water. Surfactant reduces surface tension.

question_text: 29. A sub-atomic particle of mass 10–30 kg is moving with a velocity 2.21 × 106 m/s. Under the matter wave  consideration,  the  particle  will  behave closely like ______. (h = 6.63 × 10–34 J.s)
solution:  =  h 6.63  10  34 p 10 –30  2.21 10 6 = 3 × 10–10m Hence particle will behave as x-ray.

question_text: 44. The  motion  of  an  airplane  is  represented  by velocity-time graph as shown below. The distance covered by airplane in the first 30.5 second is ____ km. 0 2  10  20  30 40 t(sec) A 200  B 400 v(m/sec)
solution: Total Area under curve.

question_text: 45. Consider  a  circular  disc  of  radius  20  cm  with centre located at the origin. A circular hole of a radius 5 cm is cut from this disc in such a way that the edge of the hole touches the edge of the disc. The  distance  of  centre  of  mass  of  residual  or remaining disc from the origin will be-
solution: 1 15 mass of disc = m mass of cut part = m 16 X com = m  0–  15 m 16 m m– 16 = 1 cm.

51. The element that does not belong to the same period of the remaining elements (modern periodic table) is:

question_text: 52. Heat treatment of muscular pain involves radiation of wavelength of about 900 nm. Which spectral line of H atom is suitable for this ? Given: Rydberg constant R H = 105 cm–1, h = 6.6 × 10–34 J s, c = 3 × 108 m/s)
53. The incorrect statements among the following is reducing agent.

options.(1): PH 3 shows lower proton affinity than NH 3.
options.(2): PF 3 exists but NF 5 does not.
options.(4): SO 2 can act as an oxidizing agent, but not as a

solution: (4) SO 2 can oxidise as well as reduce. Hence it can act as both oxidising and reducing agent.

question_text: 62. The major product of the following reaction is : CH 3CH ? 2CH=O excess HCHO reflux alkali CH 2–OH CH 2–OH CH 2–OH CH 2

question_text: 63. The  correct  stability  order  of  the  following species/molecules is : p  q  r (–) (–) H

question_text: 65. What  amount  of  bromine  will  be  required  to convert 2 g of phenol into 2, 4, 6-tribromophenol ? (Given molar mass in g mol–1 of C, H, O, Br are 12, 1, 16, 80 respectively)
solution: (1) OH  OH +3Br 2 Br Br Br +3HBr Moles of phenol =   = 0.021 2 94 Moles of bromine = 0.021 × 3 = 0.064 Mass of bromine = 0.064 × 160 = 10.22 g

question_text: 67. Given below are two statements : Statement I : In Lassaigne's  test, the covalent organic  molecules  are  transformed  into  ionic compounds. Statement II : The sodium fusion extract of an organic compound having N and S gives prussian blue colour with FeSO 4 and Na 4[Fe(CN) 6] In the light of the above statements, choose the correct answer from the options given below

options.(1): Both Statement I and Statement II are true
options.(2): Both Statement I and Statement II are false
options.(3): Statement I is false but Statement II is true
options.(4): Statement I is true but Statement II is false

solution: (4) The sodium fusion extract of organic compound having N & S gives blood red colour with FeSO 4 and Na 4[Fe(CN) 6]

question_text: 68. Which of the following happens when NH 4OH is added gradually to the solution containing 1M A2+ and 1M B3+ ions ? Given : K sp[A(OH) 2] = 9 × 10–10 and K sp[B(OH) 3] = 27 × 10–18 at 298 K. 2 3 precipitation with NH 4OH

69. Match the LIST-I with LIST-II LIST-I  LIST-II (Classification of molecules  (Example) based on octet rule) A.  Molecules  obeying  octet  I.  NO, NO 2 rule B.  Molecules with   II.  BCl 3, AlCl 3 incomplete octet C.  Molecules with incomplete  III.  H 2SO 4, PCl octet with odd electron 5 D.  Molecules  with  expanded  IV.  CCl 4, CO octet 2 Choose the correct answer from the options given below :
solution: (1) (A)A  IV (B)B  II (C)C  I (D)D  III

question_text: 71. If 1 mM solution of ethylamine produces pH = 9, then the ionization constant (K b) of ethylamine is 10–x. The value of x is ________ (nearest integer). [The degree of ionization of ethylamine can be neglected with respect to unity.]

72. During  "S"  estimation,  160  mg  of  an  organic compound gives 466 mg of barium sulphate. The percentage of Sulphur in the given compound is ______ %. (Given molar mass in g mol–1 of Ba : 137, S : 32, O : 16)

73. Consider the following sequence of reactions to produce major product (A) CH 3 i)Br 2, Fe NO 2  Major Product ii)Sn, HCl iii)NaNO 2, HCl, 273 K iv)H 3PO 2, H 2O (A) Molar mass of product (A) is ______ g mol–1. (Given molar mass in g mol–1 of C : 12, H : 1, O : 16, Br : 80, N : 14, P : 31)
solution: (171) CH 3  CH 3  CH 3 NO NO NH 2 Br 2  Sn Fe  HCl Br  Br 2 2 NaNO 2/HCl CH 3  CH 3 Br H 3PO 2 Br (A) Molar mass of product (C 7H 7Br) (A) is 171 g mol–1

75. The  standard  enthalpy  and  standard  entropy  of decomposition of N 2O 4 to NO 2 are 55.0 kJ mol–1 and 175.0 J/K/mol respectively. The standard free energy change for this reaction at 25°C in J mol–1 is _______ (Nearest integer)
solution: (2850) o rxn  H = 55 kJ/mol,  T = 298 K  S o = 175 J/mol rxn o o o rxn rxn rxn  G  H  T  S   G o J/mol– 298 × 175 J/mol rxn   G  – 52150 o rxn   G o J/mol rxn
